result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter D Blake III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Batterers Intervention program. Parenting classes. Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
No violent contact with victim (A.B.C.), contact only with consent of A.B.C.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

timeConds.notes: As to each count. Stayed pending review on 8-15-14.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Walter D Blake in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Walter D Blake in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Walter D Blake in court with attorney Glenn E Gaskill.  Katryna L Childs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing Proceeded. Court reviewed photographs from the state. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutivet, with credit for 1 DAY time served, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 18 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 25 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review (as to each count).
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No violent contact with victim (A.B.C.), contact only with consent of A.B.C.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including: supervision fees, and DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief. 
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Amended Information received and filed reflecting the amended charges:
COUNT 1 - Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
COUNT 2 - Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
  Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT  1 and 2 as amended - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Jury trial date of 4/28/2014 is vacated. 
Case adjourned to Branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-09-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Walter D Blake in court with attorney Glenn E. Gaskill.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Br 12 for Br 23. 
Case scheduled for a final pretrial.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Discussion regarding plea negotiations.  
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended as follows: 
COUNT 1 - Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor. 
COUNT 2 - Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
Case spun to branch 12, Judge Borowski for Br. 23.

Defendant Walter D Blake in court with attorney Glenn E Gaskill, III.  Cynthia Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Defense counsel requested case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON FEBRUARY 5, 2014 . IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ACB (4/10/00), unless as approved per Children's Court Orders, or if Children's Court is not involved, unless as approved per the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare.

Defendant Walter D Blake in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/14 @ 1:30pm
